data.text: 15 December 2025
data.reasoning: This is the publication date of the report.

data.text: HLIB Research Traders Brief PP 9484/12/2012 (031413)
data.reasoning: This unit identifies the publisher, document type, and a registration number, which are factual details.

data.text: Ng Jun Sheng jsng@hlib.hongleong.com.my +605-2539615
data.reasoning: This provides the author's name and contact information, which are factual details.

data.text: May revisit 1,650-1,660 after a brief pause amid Dec seasonality, RM strength and Fed-driven optimism
data.reasoning: This is a forward-looking statement, a forecast or prediction about market movement, based on various contributing factors. The word 'may' indicates uncertainty and a subjective assessment.

data.text: Daily trade stats (net trades, RM’m) Local insti Retail Foreign (5 Dec (RM'm) 131 41 (172)), (8 Dec (RM'm) 156 39 (195)), (9 Dec (RM'm) 131 15 (146)), (10 Dec (RM'm) 138 (38) (100)), (11 Dec (RM'm) 53 25 (78)), (12 Dec (RM'm) 56 (103) 47)
data.reasoning: These are specific numerical data points reporting net trades by different investor types on particular dates.

data.text: Week ended 21 Nov (RM'm) 1,005 29 (1,034), Week ended 28 Nov (RM'm) 357 128 (485), Week ended 5 Dec (RM'm) 84 (95) 11, Week ended 12 Dec (RM'm) 534 (62) (472)
data.reasoning: These are specific numerical data points reporting net trades for different weekly periods.
These are specific numerical data points reporting net trades for different quarterly, month-to-date, and year-to-date periods.

data.text: Asian markets mostly advanced, tracking record Dow and S&P 500 closings, as a tech rebound eased AI-related jitters sparked by Oracle and Broadcom.
data.reasoning: This describes observable market behavior (markets advanced) and provides reported reasons for that behavior (tracking records, tech rebound, easing jitters).

data.text: Sentiment was further supported by a dovish Fed and China’s pledge at the Central Economic Work Conference to maintain a proactive fiscal stance in 2026 to bolster consumption, investment, and growth, with policymakers reaffirming confidence in long-term fundamentals.
data.reasoning: This reports on specific events and policy statements (dovish Fed, China's pledge, policymakers' reaffirmation) that are presented as factual market influences.

data.text: Still, caution lingered ahead of next week’s expected BOJ rate hike.
data.reasoning: This reports on a prevailing market sentiment (caution) and an upcoming anticipated event (BOJ rate hike), both presented as factual observations.

data.text: The Dow fell 246 points after a two-day 1,144-point surge, as a Broadcom-led tech selloff drove rotation into cyclicals and defensives.
data.reasoning: This provides specific numerical changes in the Dow and attributes the movement to specific market actions (tech selloff, rotation).

data.text: Despite the pullback, the index still jumped 1% WoW and 1.6% MTD, with markets pricing in at least 50 bps of easing for 2026 amid expectations that Trump’s pick for Fed Chair will be dovish.
data.reasoning: This provides specific performance metrics (WoW, MTD changes) and reports on market expectations regarding future Fed policy and leadership.

data.text: Focus this week turns to delayed U.S. payrolls, the November jobless rate, retail sales, inflation data, December PMIs, and key central bank decisions from the Fed, ECB, BOE, and BOJ.
data.reasoning: This is a factual list of upcoming economic data releases and central bank decisions that market participants are monitoring.

data.text: In sync with Wall St and regional markets rallies, the KLCI jumped 12.4 pts to 1,637.8 (WoW: +1.3%, MTD: +2.1%), driven by bargain hunting in IHH, YTL, YTLPOWR, PBBANK, PETGAS and PCHEM.
data.reasoning: This reports specific numerical changes in the KLCI and identifies the stocks that contributed to the rise, all factual observations.

data.text: Gainers edged losers by 744 vs 389, with turnover stood at 3.09bn shares valued at RM2.46bn, lifted by broad-base sectors’ rally except the construction indices (-0.14%).
data.reasoning: These are specific market statistics regarding market breadth, trading volume, value, and sector performance.

data.text: Foreign investors net bought RM47m, snapping its six-day losing streak (Weekly: -RM472m; Dec MTD -RM461m, YTD -RM20.74bn), alongside net purchases by local institutions (+RM56m; weekly: RM534m, MTD: +RM618m; YTD +RM20.32bn).
data.reasoning: These are specific numerical data points detailing net purchases/sales by foreign investors and local institutions over various periods.

data.text: In contrast, retailers (-RM103m; Weekly: -RM62m, MTD -RM157m; YTD +RM0.42bn) emerged as the key net sellers.
data.reasoning: These are specific numerical data points detailing net purchases/sales by retailers over various periods.

data.text: Market snapshot: Dow chg, KLCI chg, G/L ratios from 5-Dec to 12-Dec, e.g., 12-Dec 48458 (246) 1637.8 12.4 1.92
data.reasoning: This table presents specific numerical data for market indices and breadth over several days, which are verifiable facts.

data.text: Average daily trading (ADT): ADT Vol (bn shrs) and ADT Value (RM'bn) for various periods, e.g., Dec MTD 3.55 2.50
data.reasoning: This table presents specific numerical data for average daily trading volume and value, which are verifiable facts.

data.text: In anticipation of Wall Street’s year-end Santa Claus rally, the KLCI is poised to grind higher by end Dec, despite lingering risks from a potential BOJ hike on 19 Dec, China–Japan tensions, and possible cabinet shifts following the 29 Nov Sabah polls.
data.reasoning: This is a forecast about the KLCI's future movement ('poised to grind higher'), acknowledging both positive drivers (Santa Claus rally) and specific potential risks. The language indicates a subjective assessment.

data.text: Still, solid fundamentals (2025/26 GDP: 4.5/4.1%), undemanding valuation (2026F P/E: 14.2x vs 5Y mean 17.2x), strengthening RM vs USD (8.4% YTD) and supportive Dec seasonality (average returns 10Y/20Y: +2.1%/2.0%) would keep the backdrop constructive, setting the stage for a stronger end-Dec closing toward the 1,650–1,660 zones.
data.reasoning: This is a qualitative assessment ('constructive backdrop', 'stronger end-Dec closing') based on various quantitative data points (GDP, P/E, RM strength, seasonality). The conclusion drawn from these facts is a subjective interpretation and forecast.

data.text: We remain sanguine of a potential LT downtrend line breakout (from all-time high 1,897 in Apr 2018) on the KLCI, which continues to ride above its support trendline and above 20D MA/ 1,619, amid expectations of strong December seasonality and continued Fed-cut optimism coupled with RM strength.
data.reasoning: This expresses a positive sentiment ('sanguine') and a technical analysis forecast ('potential LT downtrend line breakout') based on technical indicators and market expectations.

data.text: A decisive breakout above 1,641 (downtrend line) would open the door for a further advance toward 1,659 (52-week high) and 1,686 (110% FE) levels.
data.reasoning: This is a conditional forecast based on technical analysis, predicting future price targets if a specific technical event (breakout) occurs.

data.text: Failure to clear this hurdle may keep the index in consolidation, with support seen at 1,600 (trendline).
data.reasoning: This is a conditional forecast based on technical analysis, predicting a consolidation scenario and identifying a support level if a technical hurdle is not cleared.

data.text: Figure #1 Virtual portfolio: Entry Price, S1, S2, R1, R2, LT Target price, Last Price, Highest/Lowest price since report, Gains/Loss for OSK, SUNNY OPTICAL, GAMUDA, MCEHLDG, SUNWAY, MNHLDG.
data.reasoning: This table contains specific numerical data and historical trade remarks for a virtual portfolio, representing recorded performance and actions.

data.text: Figure #2 Virtual portfolio performance: Total calls made, Total winners, Total losers, Successful hit rates, Average return, Relative against CI for cumulative, Jan-Dec 2025, and YTD 2025.
data.reasoning: This table presents specific numerical summary statistics of the virtual portfolio's performance over various periods, which are verifiable facts as reported.

data.text: HLIB Retail Research runs a “virtual portfolio” and this should not be construed that HLIB has taken a position.
data.reasoning: This statement defines the nature of the portfolio and clarifies that it does not represent actual positions taken by HLIB, which is a guiding principle for interpretation.

data.text: Maximum holding period for stocks recommended are ranging from one week to four weeks. We will take profit (depending on strength of technical chart reading) should share price reach our R1/R2/LT upside targets.
data.reasoning: This describes the operational rules and strategy for managing positions within the virtual portfolio.

data.text: We will close the positions upon expiry of the maximum holding period even if the stocks fail to achieve our R1/R2/LT upside targets and/or remained above the cut loss level;
data.reasoning: This outlines a specific rule for closing positions based on time, regardless of target achievement.

data.text: For Sell ratings, we consider the return as equivalent to the losses make if investors did not sell;
data.reasoning: This defines the methodology for calculating returns specifically for sell ratings.

data.text: Prices shall be adjusted accordingly in the event of relevant exercises (i.e. dividend, bonus, rights issues etc)
data.reasoning: This is a rule stating how prices will be modified under certain corporate actions.

data.text: S=support; R=resistance;
data.reasoning: These are factual definitions of abbreviations used in the report.

data.text: For those that we took profit, this column shows the price level which we exited from the trade.
data.reasoning: This is a factual explanation of a data point in the virtual portfolio table.

data.text: Excluding brokerage, stamp duty as well as clearing fees.
data.reasoning: This is a factual statement about what is excluded from the performance calculations.

data.text: BUY Expected absolute return of +10% or more over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'BUY' stock rating.

data.text: HOLD Expected absolute return of -10% to +10% over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'HOLD' stock rating.

data.text: SELL Expected absolute return of -10% or less over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'SELL' stock rating.

data.text: UNDER REVIEW Rating on the stock is temporarily under review which may or may not result in a change from the previous rating.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'UNDER REVIEW' stock rating.

data.text: NOT RATED Stock is not or no longer within regular coverage.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'NOT RATED' stock status.

data.text: OVERWEIGHT Sector expected to outperform the market over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'OVERWEIGHT' sector rating.

data.text: NEUTRAL Sector expected to perform in-line with the market over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'NEUTRAL' sector rating.

data.text: UNDERWEIGHT Sector expected to underperform the market over the next 12 months.
data.reasoning: This is a definition or principle of the 'UNDERWEIGHT' sector rating.

data.text: The stock rating guide as stipulated above serves as a guiding principle to stock ratings. However, apart from the abovementioned quantitative definitions, other qualitative measures and situational aspects will also be considered when arriving at the final stock rating. Stock rating may also be affected by the market capitalisation of the individual stock under review.
data.reasoning: This explains the overall principle and flexibility in applying the stock rating guide, incorporating qualitative factors beyond strict quantitative definitions.
